Article.Abstract: The memory T cell response is polyclonal, with the magnitude and specificity of the response controlled in part by the burst size of T cells expanded from effector/memory precursors. Sensitive assays using HLA class II multimers were used to detect low-frequency Ag-specific T cells directed against influenza viral Ags in subjects immunized with the influenza vaccine. Direct ex vivo tetramer staining of PBMC from five individuals identified frequencies of hemagglutinin (HA) 306-318 tetramer binding CD4(+) T cells in the peripheral blood ranging from 1 in 600 to 1 in 30,000 CD4(+) T cells. These frequencies were validated by counting CFSE(low), tetramer-positive T cells after in vitro expansion. Low frequency of T cells directed to other influenza epitopes, including DRA1*0101/DRB1*0401-restricted matrix protein 60-73, DRA1*0101/DRB1*0101-restricted matrix protein 18-29, DRA1*0101/DRB1*0701-restricted HA 232-244 and DRA1*0101/DRB1*0101-restricted nucleoprotein 206-217 were also determined. T cells which occurred at a frequency as low as 1 in 350,000 could be ascertained by in vitro expansion of precursors. Peripheral HA(306-318)-responsive T cells expanded 2- to 5-fold following influenza vaccination. Examination of phenotypic markers of the HA(306-318)-responsive T cells in the peripheral blood indicated that the majority were CD45RA(-), CD27(+), CD25(-), CD28(+), and CD62L(-), while T cell clones derived from this population were CD45RA(-), CD27(-), CD25(+), CD28(+), and CD62L(-).
Article.ArticleTitle: HLA class II-restricted CD4+ T cell responses directed against influenza viral antigens postinfluenza vaccination.
Article.Affiliations: Benaroya Research Institute at Virginia Mason, Seattle, WA 98101, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: 5-(6)-carboxyfluorescein diacetate succinimidyl ester;Antigens, Viral;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;Fluoresceins;HLA-DR Antigens;Hemagglutinin Glycoproteins, Influenza Virus;Influenza Vaccines;Peptide Fragments;Succinimides

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated within a 60 day period from healthy subjects vaccinated with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined to be 1 in 64,000 out of a population of CD+ T cells in culture with adherent cells in the presence of an unspecified peptide (most likely HA 306-318) after 6 days and 7 divisions. The alpha chain of DR molecule was specified as DRA1*0101.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated within a 60 day period from healthy subjects vaccinated with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined to be 1 in 12,000 out of a population of CD+ T cells in culture with adherent cells in the presence of an unspecified peptide (most likely HA 306-318) after 6 days and 7 divisions. The alpha chain of DR molecule was specified as DRA1*0101.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated within a 60 day period from healthy subjects vaccinated with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined to be 1 in 350,000 out of a population of CD+ T cells in culture with adherent cells in the presence of an unspecified peptide (most likely HA 306-318) after 6 days and 9 divisions. The alpha chain of DR molecule was specified as DRA1*0101.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated within a 60 day period from healthy subjects vaccinated with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined to be 1 in 196,000 out of a population of CD+ T cells in culture with adherent cells in the presence of an unspecified peptide (most likely HA 306-318) after 6 days and 9 divisions. The alpha chain of DR molecule was specified as DRA1*0101.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope specific CD4+ T cells proliferated (by CFSE) in response to the epitope presented by adherent cells. The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined in two donors to be 1 in 26,000 or 1 in 8,000 after 6 days of culture in the presence of the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope specific CD4+ T cells proliferated (by CFSE) in response to the epitope presented by adherent cells. The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined in two donors to be 1 in 26,000 or 1 in 8,000 after 6 days of culture in the presence of the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells in peripheral blood recognizing the epitope was determined in two donors to be 1 in 600 or 1 in 30,000 by tetramer staining and CFSE calculations. The frequency of epitope-specific CD4+ cells was shown to increase 2 to 5 fold 10 days after influenza vaccination.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope in peripheral blood was determined to be 1 in 6,000 or 1 in 11,000 by tetramer staining and CFSE. The frequency of epitope-specific CD4+ cells was shown to increase 2 to 5 fold 10 days after influenza vaccination.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells in peripheral blood recognizing the epitope was determined in two donors to be 1 in 600 or 1 in 30,000 by tetramer staining and CFSE calculations. The frequency of epitope-specific CD4+ cells was shown to increase 2 to 5 fold 10 days after influenza vaccination.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFNg measured by ELISPOT was used to estimate the frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope in peripheral blood (1 in 10,000, 1 in 36,000 and 1 in 9,000). These results are similar to the estimation determined by using tetramer staining and CFSE.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope specific tetramer + CD4+ T cells were measured in a mixed population of non-MHC matched PBMC and a known number of an epitope specific T cell line in order to determine tetramer sensitivity. Epitope specific CD4+ T cells were detected at a sensitivity of 0.003%.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope in peripheral blood was estimated to be 1 in 6,000, 1 in 11,000, 1 in 51,000, and 1 in 9,000 by tetramer staining and CFSE using four different donors. These results are similar to the estimation determined by using an IFNg ELISPOT assay. The frequency of epitope-specific CD4+ cells was shown to increase 2 to 5 fold 10 days after influenza vaccination.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined in two donors to be 1 in 26,000 or 1 in 8,000 (by CFSE calculations) after 6 days of culture with adherent cells in the presence of the epitope. The majority of these tetramer+ CD4+ T cells expressed V beta 3 and were CD45RA-. A small population of CD45RA+, CD62L-, CD27+, CD28+ cells were also present.

FirstInVivoProcess.ImmunogenReferenceName: Trivalent Type A and B Influenza Virus Fluzone Vaccine

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were isolated from healthy subjects within a 60 day period of vaccination with Fluzone vaccine.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of CD4+ T cells recognizing the epitope was determined in two donors to be 1 in 26,000 or 1 in 8,000 (by CFSE calculations) after 6 days of culture with adherent cells in the presence of the epitope.
